channel.title: iPod touch deadlocked
channel.description:
Alright, well I had a ton of shit on my iPod that I didn't want anymore so I went through the reset process. Just before I did this my iPod notified me of it's 20% battery life left. I figured that I'd have enough, so I proceeded. After about 30-40 minutes through, my iPod shut off. This was all while I was at the orthodontist's office, so I figured I'd wait till I get home to continue. When I plugged it in, it just gives me the Apple logo with a loading icon and it just sits there like that.
It also doesn't seem to charge, because after leaving it charging for about an hour or two it still told me that there was no battery to turn the iPod.
Anyone have any ideas on how to fix it?

item.title: iPod touch deadlocked
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

did it with my 3g literally on sunday.

  1. make sure your not connected to ure pc
  2. turn it off (hard turn off where u press and hold both home and standby)…
  3. Press and hold the HOME button.
  4. Then connect it to your computer,(WHILST STILL HOLDING HOME) Your itunes should say “itunes has detected your phone in recovery mode… you must restore to continue” And also your device should show the “connect to itunes” symbol

Thats how i got it to work… what you described sounds like the EXACT same problem i had. Make sure then when you press and HOLD the home button whilst u plug in ure USB)

PM me if u need more help.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:10, topic:343817”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=440206.msg3234608#msg3234608 date=1276377011]

Pay Apple. That’s what you get for buying products from shitty companies!
[/quote]Does your warranty void if you’ve jail-broken it?

You can just restore it to factory settings.[/quote]

Being able to restore it would defeat the purpose of even taking it to apple. Learn to read.

item.title: iPod touch deadlocked
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Tried putting it into DFU mode and then seeing if itunes will recognise it? (hold Home & Power button for like 10 secs)

Read full topic

item.title: iPod touch deadlocked
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:7, topic:343817”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=440206.msg3234714#msg3234714 date=1276380651]
Have you tried resetting it again? Maybe try resetting it while charging. Or if it wont let you do that, reset it while disconnected from your computer then connect it again to maintain power.

Oh wait I was thinking this was a normal iPod. I take it the reset process is similar anyway? (a few button combinations)
[/quote]There’s only one button…[/quote]

Home Button, Power Button, and unless it’s a G1 iTouch, there’s a volume rocker.

Read full topic

Pay Apple. That’s what you get for buying products from shitty companies!

Definitely. Look on google for repairing it(as in restoring a previous firmware, not taking it apart or anything) from home, other wise it looks like you’ll have to send it off.
